us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class BoundingBox3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.BoundingBox3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<BoundingBox3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<BoundingBox3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<BoundingBox3D>

    public class BoundingBox3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<BoundingBox3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<BoundingBox3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<BoundingBox3D>
    A BoundingBox3D can be used to defines from a set of minimum and maximum coordinates an axis-aligned bounding box.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoundingBox3D()
      Creates a new bounding box initialized with both its minimum and maximum coordinates to (0, 0).
      BoundingBox3D(BoundingBox3D other)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to other.
      BoundingBox3D(double[] min, double[] max)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to the given minimum and maximum coordinates.
      BoundingBox3D(double minX, double minY, double minZ, double maxX, double maxY, double maxZ)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to the given minimum and maximum coordinates.
      BoundingBox3D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly min, us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly max)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to the given minimum and maximum coordinates.

    • Method Detail

      • createUsingCenterAndPlusMinusVector

        public static BoundingBox3D createUsingCenterAndPlusMinusVector(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly center,
                                                                us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DReadOnly plusMinusTuple)
        Creates a new bounding box 3D from its center coordinate center and a tuple 3D holding onto half its size plusMinusTuple.

        The minimum and maximum coordinates of the resulting bounding box are calculated as follows:

        • minPoint = center - plusMinusTuple
        • maxPoint = center + plusMinusTuple

        Parameters:
        center - the center coordinate of the new bounding box. Not modified.
        plusMinusTuple - tuple representing half of the size of the new bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the new bounding box.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if any of the minimum coordinates is strictly greater than the maximum coordinate on the same axis.

      • union

        public static BoundingBox3D union(BoundingBox3D boundingBoxOne,
                                  BoundingBox3D boundingBoxTwo)
        Creates a new bounding box such that it is the smallest bounding box containing the two given bounding boxes boundingBoxOne and boundingBoxTwo.
        Parameters:
        boundingBoxOne - the first bounding box. Not modified.
        boundingBoxTwo - the second bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the new bounding box.

      • combine

        public void combine(BoundingBox3D boundingBoxOne,
                    BoundingBox3D boundingBoxTwo)
        Sets this bounding box to the union of boundingBoxOne and boundingBoxTwo.

        This bounding box is set such that it is the smallest bounding box containing the two given bounding boxes.

        Parameters:
        boundingBoxOne - the first bounding box. Can be the same instance as this. Not modified.
        boundingBoxTwo - the second bounding box. Can be the same instance as this. Not modified.

      • getCenterPoint

        public void getCenterPoint(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics centerToPack)
        Calculates the coordinate of the center of this bounding box and stores it in the given centerToPack.
        Parameters:
        centerToPack - point 3D in which the center of this bounding box is stored. Modified.

      • getPointGivenParameters

        public void getPointGivenParameters(double xParameter,
                                    double yParameter,
                                    double zParameter,
                                    us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics pointToPack)
        Performs a linear interpolation between this bounding box minimum and maximum coordinates using independent parameters xParameter, yParameter, and zParameter for the x-axis, y-axis, and z-axis respectively. The result is stored in pointToPack.

        • (xParameter == 0) results in: (pointToPack.getX() == this.getMinX()).
        • (xParameter == 1) results in: (pointToPack.getX() == this.getMaxX()).
        • (yParameter == 0) results in: (pointToPack.getY() == this.getMinY()).
        • (yParameter == 1) results in: (pointToPack.getY() == this.getMaxY()).
        • (zParameter == 0) results in: (pointToPack.getZ() == this.getMinZ()).
        • (zParameter == 1) results in: (pointToPack.getZ() == this.getMaxZ()).

        Parameters:
        xParameter - the parameter to use for the interpolation along the x-axis.
        yParameter - the parameter to use for the interpolation along the y-axis.
        zParameter - the parameter to use for the interpolation along the z-axis.
        pointToPack - the point 3D in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • getDiagonalLengthSquared

        public double getDiagonalLengthSquared()
        Calculates the squared value of the distance between the minimum and maximum coordinates of this bounding box.
        Returns:
        the squared value of this bounding box diagonal.

      • isInsideExclusive

        public boolean isInsideExclusive(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly query)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box.

        The query is considered to be outside if located exactly on an edge of this bounding box.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the query is inside, false if outside or located on an edge of this bounding box.

      • isInsideExclusive

        public boolean isInsideExclusive(double x,
                                 double y,
                                 double z)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box.

        The query is considered to be outside if located exactly on an edge of this bounding box.

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        z - the z-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the query is inside, false if outside or located on an edge of this bounding box.

        The query is considered to be inside if located exactly on an edge of this bounding box.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box.

        z - the z-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the query is inside or located on an edge of this bounding box, false if outside.

      • isInsideEpsilon

        public boolean isInsideEpsilon(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly query,
                               double epsilon)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box given the tolerance epsilon.

        • if epsilon == 0, this method is equivalent to isInsideExclusive(Point3DReadOnly).
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled up by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled down by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the inside.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside the bounding box, false otherwise.

      • isInsideEpsilon

        public boolean isInsideEpsilon(double x,
                               double y,
                               double z,
                               double epsilon)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box given the tolerance epsilon.

        • if epsilon == 0, this method is equivalent to isInsideExclusive(Point3DReadOnly).
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled up by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled down by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the inside.

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        y - the y-coordinate the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        z - the z-coordinate the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside the bounding box, false otherwise.

      • isXYInsideExclusive

        public boolean isXYInsideExclusive(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly query)
        Tests if the query is located inside the projection onto the XY-plane of this bounding box.

        The query is considered to be outside if located exactly on an edge of this bounding box.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the query is inside, false if outside or located on an edge of this bounding box.

      • intersectsExclusive

        public boolean intersectsExclusive(BoundingBox3D other)
        Tests if this bounding box and other intersects.

        The two bounding boxes are considered to not be intersecting if they share a corner or an edge.

        Parameters:
        other - the other bounding box to test if it is intersecting with this bounding box. Not Modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes intersect, false otherwise.

        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled down by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the inside.

        epsilon - the tolerance to use in this test.
        Returns:

        public boolean intersectsExclusiveInXYPlane(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other)
        Tests if this bounding box and other intersects.

        The two bounding boxes are considered to not be intersecting if they share a corner or an edge.

        This method is equivalent to projecting this bounding box onto the XY-plane before performing the test.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes intersect, false otherwise.

        public boolean intersectsEpsilonInXYPlane(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other,
                                          double epsilon)

        This method is equivalent to projecting this bounding box onto the XY-plane before performing the test.

        Parameters:

        epsilon - the tolerance to use in this test.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes intersect, false otherwise.

      • intersectionWithLine3D

        public int intersectionWithLine3D(Line3DReadOnly line3D,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a line and this bounding box.

        In the case the line and the bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack remains unmodified.

        Parameters:
        line3D - the query. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0 or 2.

      • intersectionWithLine3D

        public int intersectionWithLine3D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly pointOnLine,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DReadOnly lineDirection,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a line and this bounding box.

        In the case the line and the bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack remains unmodified.

        Parameters:
        pointOnLine - a point located on the infinitely long line. Not modified.
        lineDirection - the line direction. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0 or 2.

      • intersectionWithLineSegment3D

        public int intersectionWithLineSegment3D(LineSegment3DReadOnly lineSegment3D,
                                         us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                         us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a line segment and this bounding box.

        Intersection(s) between the line segment and this bounding box can only exist between the endpoints of the line segment.

        In the case the line segment and this bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack remains unmodified.

        In the case only one intersection exists between the line segment and the bounding box, firstIntersectionToPack will contain the coordinate of the intersection and secondIntersectionToPack will be set to contain only Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        lineSegment3D - the query. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line segment and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0, 1, or 2.

      • intersectionWithLineSegment3D

        public int intersectionWithLineSegment3D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly lineSegmentStart,
                                         us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly lineSegmentEnd,
                                         us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                         us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a line segment and this bounding box.

        Intersection(s) between the line segment and this bounding box can only exist between the endpoints of the line segment.

        In the case the line segment and this bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack are set to Double.NaN.

        In the case only one intersection exists between the line segment and the bounding box, firstIntersectionToPack will contain the coordinate of the intersection and secondIntersectionToPack will be set to contain only Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        lineSegmentStart - the first endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        lineSegmentEnd - the second endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line segment and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0, 1, or 2.

      • intersectionWithRay3D

        public int intersectionWithRay3D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly rayOrigin,
                                 us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DReadOnly rayDirection,
                                 us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                 us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a ray and this bounding box.

        Intersection(s) between the ray and the bounding box cannot exist before the origin of the ray.

        In the case the ray and this bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack are set to Double.NaN.

        In the case only one intersection exists between the ray and this bounding box, firstIntersectionToPack will contain the coordinate of the intersection and secondIntersectionToPack will be set to contain only Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        rayOrigin - the coordinate of the ray origin. Not modified.
        rayDirection - the direction of the ray. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the ray and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0, 1, or 2.

                             double epsilon)

        Parameters:

        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(BoundingBox3D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two bounding boxes are geometrically similar, i.e. the distance between their min and max points is less than or equal to epsilon.
        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<BoundingBox3D>
        Parameters:
        other - the bounding box to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
